alert.note: Alert for Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 8:54PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Box Elder and northwestern Tooele Counties through 945 PM MDT... At 853 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Utah Test and Training Range South, or 23 miles east of Wendover, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rainfall will cause ponding of water and difficult driving conditions on Interstate 80. Reduce speeds. Locations impacted include... Utah Test and Training Range North, Utah Test and Training Range South and Bonneville Salt Flats. This includes Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 17 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains
